Detailed Description

CallBarringHandler is a Supplementary Service handler responsible for activating, deactivating and interrogating the Call Waiting SS.

The CallBarringHandler is a SS handler responsible for modifying the Call Barring SS. This includes activating and deactivating specific services, setting passwords on those services as well as interrogating their current status. The handler provides various methods with different parameter signatures for these purposes. The call barring supplementary service consists of this set of subservices:

  • all call barrings
  • all outgoing call barrings
  • barring of all outgoing calls
  • barring of all outgoing international calls
  • barring of all outgoing international calls except those directed at the home PLMN country
  • all incoming call barrings
  • barring of all incoming calls
  • barring of all incoming calls when roaming outside the home PLMN
Therefore the desired subservice or subservice group has to specified.

SsApiRc CallBarringHandler::Activate (  SsCode  ss_code,
const WString &  pw,
ServiceGroup  basic_service = AllServices,
const WString &  override_ss_sequence = L"",
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE,
LineSelector  line = InvalidLine
) 
 

Activates call barring.
Activates the given call barring kind and optionally for a specific basic service group.
This method triggers sending of *<code dependend on parameter>*<pw>*<mmi_code># to the mobile network.

Parameters:
ss_code The supplementary service code describing the desired service (all call barrings, barring of all outgoing calls, etc.).
pw The call barring password.
basic_service The basic service group the request (all services, all teleservices, etc.), defaults to all services.
override_ss_sequence Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
Returns:
Any value SsMainHandler::BeginTransaction might return
or any other value CheckParameterCodes might return.

SsApiRc CallBarringHandler::ChangePassword (  const WString &  old_pw,
const WString &  new_pw,
const WString &  conf_pw,
const WString &  override_ss_sequence = L"",
BOOLEAN  register_only = FALSE,
BOOLEAN  provide_ss_code = TRUE
) 
 

Changes the call barring password.
Cahnges the password for all call barring services. The call barring password is needed to activate or deactivate the service. This method triggers sending of *03*330*<old_pw>*<new_pw>*<conf_pw># to the mobile network.

Parameters:
old_pw The old call barring password.
new_pw The new call barring password.
conf_pw The confirmation of the new call barring password, this has to match the new_pw string.
override_ss_sequence Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
provide_ss_code If set to FALSE, *03**.. is sent instead of *03*330*...
Returns:
InvalidServiceCode - if the supplementary service code is not of a call barring kind,
ConfPasswordMismatch - if the new password does not match the confirmation password,
or any other value SsMainHandler::BeginTransaction might return.

Interrogates the call barring status.
Requests the status of the given call barring kind and optionally for a specific basic service group.
This method triggers sending of *#<code dependend on parameter>*<mmi_code># to the mobile network.

Parameters:

basic_service The basic service group the request (all services, all teleservices, etc.), defaults to all services.
override_ss_sequence Supplementary Service request string to be sent to net, overrides handler generated request string.
register_only A flag that indicates if the request is sent to the GSM stack or only registered at SsMainHandler.
Returns:
Any value SsMainHandler::BeginTransaction might return
or any other value CheckParameterCodes might return.
